originalText.text: A great experience! I love the BIG APPLE! I left my heart in New York.

text.text: A great experience! I love the BIG APPLE! I left my heart in New York.

originalText.text: My family and I were on a short weekend visit to NYC and our last stop was to see the Statue of Liberty before we flew back to Texas. I had purchased the New York City Pass, and I could not get the application to support a confirmation on the New Jersey Ferry to the Statue of Liberty.  When I went to the window to ask for help or purchase tickets (which would have cost me about $100 ), the teller at the window tried to help me get the app to scan.  He then brought out additional support--Josef.  This employee went above and beyond in his kindness and support of our goal to see Lady Liberty, up to walking us to the ferry site.  I commend the entire team on the New Jersey Ferry site for their kindness and support of tourists. While the fact the New York City Pass did not scan was extremely frustrating, the fact that help was given in such a kind manner was amazing. I just want to make sure Josef and the teller are commended for their great customer support. Thank you!  These Texans left that day with the best of feelings for our new friends in New Jersey!

originalText.text: Beatiful experience highly recommended the its really worth it you learn so much we got there early at liberty state park pass the security and got on the 9 am ferry I recommend to go with enough time so you can live the whole experience they have theaters a no cost on both ellis island and the statu we couldn't get in the statu because is booked until October so order your tickets ahead if time we will come back , lines are longer in the afternoon went this sunday it took about 10 or 15 minutes

originalText.text:
Told us to arrive 10 minutes early to get the ferry at 2pm. We had to wait 2 hours till we got on the ferry.
Booked a ticket to get to Ellis Island and liberty island. They then told us to decide which one we wanted to visit because of the shortage of time

originalText.text: Booked a reserved ticket on the morning we decided to go. Unfortunately you have to book well in advance to do the crown. For us it was booked months out. As for the reservation looks like getting the tickets emailed to you was the best option. As they can scan your email at each point. Skip the will-call option. Also despite the savings the New York City Pass offers reserving your tickets saves you hours of waiting in their  “flex” ticket line.
